videos.title: Jhula - Manish Khushalani (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Jhula" by Manish Khushalani, released in 2024, explores themes of vulnerability, trust, and the delicate nature of relationships. The video combines Indian classical elements with contemporary electronic music, creating a unique visual and auditory experience. The narrative is driven by a series of intimate and evocative scenes that reflect the song's emotional depth, showcasing a blend of traditional and modern aesthetics that highlight the fusion of cultural influences. The visuals are crafted to complement the haunting melody and poignant lyrics, making for a captivating and immersive experience.
videos.additional_info:
Jhula - Manish Khushalani (2024)
The music video for "Jhula" by Manish Khushalani, released in 2024, explores themes of vulnerability, trust, and the delicate nature of relationships. The video combines Indian classical elements with contemporary electronic music, creating a unique visual and auditory experience. The narrative is driven by a series of intimate and evocative scenes that reflect the song's emotional depth, showcasing a blend of traditional and modern aesthetics that highlight the fusion of cultural influences. The visuals are crafted to complement the haunting melody and poignant lyrics, making for a captivating and immersive experience.
Technique - Levitation
Director - Manish Khushalani
Editor - Manish Khushalani
Colorist - Vineesh Vijayan

videos.alt_text: Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid
videos.title: Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid (2023)
videos.description: Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid (2023)
videos.additional_info:
Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid (2023)
A mesmerizing music video featuring a chaotic journey initiated by Diplo's spiked chicken nugget, showcasing wild camera angles, unusual characters, and intense visual effects set in a quirky vintage Chinese restaurant. Director Seaman's close collaboration with Francis ensures a deep connection with the song's rhythms and lyrics, bringing to life a vividly demented world that captivates viewers, with or without the influence of LSD.
Technique - Levitation
Director - Parker Seaman
DOP - Franklin Ricart
Editor - Jacob Ehrlich
Colorist - Josh Bohoskey
Original Source - Link

videos.alt_text: Duda Beat feat. Trevo - Nem Um Pouquinho
videos.title: Duda Beat feat. Trevo - Nem Um Pouquinho (2021)
videos.description: Duda Beat's single "Nem Um Pouquinho" featuring Trevo presents a cyberpunk and dystopian universe where she plays a metamorphic creature seeking revenge in a bitter heartbreak narrative. The video complements this theme with a fantastic approach, featuring urban arts, signage, and vehicles developed by the production design team, while the barbed rose symbolizes fatal charm throughout the project.
videos.additional_info:
Duda Beat feat. Trevo - Nem Um Pouquinho (2021)
Duda Beat's single "Nem Um Pouquinho" featuring Trevo presents a cyberpunk and dystopian universe where she plays a metamorphic creature seeking revenge in a bitter heartbreak narrative. The video complements this theme with a fantastic approach, featuring urban arts, signage, and vehicles developed by the production design team, while the barbed rose symbolizes fatal charm throughout the project.
Technique - Levitation , Magical realism , Spotlight , Void

videos.title: A$AP Rocky - A$AP Forever (2018)
videos.description: A$AP Rocky returns as the "fashion killa" in the music video for his latest single, "A$AP Forever," featuring Moby. Directed by Dexter Navy, the video features Rocky and the A$AP Mob in various New York locations, with a cameo by Moby, credited for the heavy sampling of his 1999 hit "Porcelain."

videos.title: Her Morning Elegance (2009)
videos.description: A collaborative stop motion film by musician Oren Lavie and Israeli photographer Eyal Landesman. The only stop-motion video to ever earn a grammy nomination, this whimsical video accompanies the song of same name by Lavie. The camera remains stationary while bedroom linens and clothing move across the mattress as personifications of the birds, trains, and fish she dreams of.
videos.director: Oren Lavie, Yuval and Merav Nathan
videos.additional_info:
Her Morning Elegance (2009)
A collaborative stop motion film by musician Oren Lavie and Israeli photographer Eyal Landesman. The only stop-motion video to ever earn a grammy nomination, this whimsical video accompanies the song of same name by Lavie. The camera remains stationary while bedroom linens and clothing move across the mattress as personifications of the birds, trains, and fish she dreams of.
Technique - Levitation , Overhead , Pixilation , Stop Motion , Underwater
Director - Oren Lavie, Yuval and Merav Nathan
DOP - Eyal Landsman

videos.title: Rema - Trouble Maker (2023)
videos.description: The "Trouble Maker" music video by Rema, directed by Meji Alabi, features vibrant visuals and dynamic choreography that emphasize themes of triumph and resilience. Enhanced by Blaisebeatz's production, it provides a cinematic experience that complements the track's infectious beats. The video showcases Rema's unique style and artistic versatility.

videos.director: Erin McCaffrey, Rock Paper Scissors, Sebastian Zotoff
videos.additional_info:
Sub Urban - UH OH! (feat. BENEE) (2022)
In Andrew Donoho's "Uh Oh" video, Sub Urban, portraying an imperfect Jehovah's Witness, disturbs an idyllic suburban neighborhood, blurring the line between who is truly the source of terror. Credits: Story & Creative Direction by Sub Urban Directed by Andrew Donoho Production Company - Obsidian Executive Producer - Doug Klinger Head of Production - Anna Heinrich Producer - Ian Blair Director’s Rep - Doug Klinger at Reprobates Production Manager - Kristen Brancaccio Production Coordinator - John Wayne Leingang Director of Photography - Kristian Zuniga Assistant Director - Michael Estrella 2nd Assistant Director - Mike Roque 1st AC - Jackie Vresics 2nd AC - Aaron Brenner Steadicam - Loren Hamilton Gaffer - Drew Valenti ACLT - Dominic D'astice Hyphenate - David Veerman Key Grip - Ed Barraza Best Grip - Jason Webster Grip - Gaither Narron

videos.alt_text: "The Fear Cycle" Film - Unveiling Sleep Paralysis Through Art
videos.title: "The Fear Cycle" Film - Unveiling Sleep Paralysis Through Art (2024)
videos.description: "The Fear Cycle" film explores Nicolas Bruno’s experiences with Sleep Paralysis, a sleep disorder that causes vivid nightmares. Bruno transforms his fears into artwork, giving viewers a glimpse into each dream sequence. This film delves into Bruno's creative journey, showcasing his artistic process, dream journal entries, and theatrical renditions of his visions.
videos.additional_info:

videos.title: Jhula - Manish Khushalani (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Jhula" by Manish Khushalani, released in 2024, explores themes of vulnerability, trust, and the delicate nature of relationships. The video combines Indian classical elements with contemporary electronic music, creating a unique visual and auditory experience. The narrative is driven by a series of intimate and evocative scenes that reflect the song's emotional depth, showcasing a blend of traditional and modern aesthetics that highlight the fusion of cultural influences. The visuals are crafted to complement the haunting melody and poignant lyrics, making for a captivating and immersive experience.
videos.additional_info:

The visuals are crafted to complement the haunting melody and poignant lyrics, making for a captivating and immersive experience.
Technique - Levitation , Match Cut , Overhead , Two Shot
Director - Manish Khushalani
Editor - Manish Khushalani
Colorist - Vineesh Vijayan

videos.title: Valentino Khan - Deep Down Low (2016)
videos.description: One of the weirdest music videos you'll ever watch. We don't recommend watching while high. Actually scratch that. Even better when high. Fever, hallucinogens, or the hypnotic beat at the track make his nightmares increasingly bizarre. In the restaurant, dancing facial features and tentacles sprouting from a waitress's eyes push him to flee the surreal scene.

videos.alt_text: Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid
videos.title: Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid (2023)
videos.description: Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid (2023)
videos.additional_info:
Dillon Francis, Good Times Ahead - LA On Acid (2023)
A mesmerizing music video featuring a chaotic journey initiated by Diplo's spiked chicken nugget, showcasing wild camera angles, unusual characters, and intense visual effects set in a quirky vintage Chinese restaurant. Director Seaman's close collaboration with Francis ensures a deep connection with the song's rhythms and lyrics, bringing to life a vividly demented world that captivates viewers, with or without the influence of LSD.
Technique - Levitation , Low Angle
Director - Parker Seaman
DOP - Franklin Ricart
Editor - Jacob Ehrlich
Colorist - Josh Bohoskey
Original Source - Link

videos.title: Sub Urban - UH OH! (feat. BENEE) (2022)
videos.director: Erin McCaffrey, Rock Paper Scissors, Sebastian Zotoff
videos.additional_info:
Sub Urban - UH OH! (feat. BENEE) (2022)
In Andrew Donoho's "Uh Oh" video, Sub Urban, portraying an imperfect Jehovah's Witness, disturbs an idyllic suburban neighborhood, blurring the line between who is truly the source of terror. Credits: Story & Creative Direction by Sub Urban Directed by Andrew Donoho Production Company - Obsidian Executive Producer - Doug Klinger Head of Production - Anna Heinrich Producer - Ian Blair Director’s Rep - Doug Klinger at Reprobates Production Manager - Kristen Brancaccio Production Coordinator - John Wayne Leingang Director of Photography - Kristian Zuniga Assistant Director - Michael Estrella 2nd Assistant Director - Mike Roque 1st AC - Jackie Vresics 2nd AC - Aaron Brenner Steadicam - Loren Hamilton Gaffer - Drew Valenti ACLT - Dominic D'astice Hyphenate - David Veerman Key Grip - Ed Barraza Best Grip - Jason Webster Grip - Gaither Narron
Technique - Levitation , Tracking
Director - Andrew Donoho
DOP - Kristian Zuniga
Editor - Erin McCaffrey, Rock P

videos.alt_text: TID Exploring Time 005 by Builders Club
videos.title: TID Exploring Time 005 by Builders Club (2017)
videos.additional_info:
TID Exploring Time 005 by Builders Club (2017)
'It's an observation of a moment in time and what happens to our mind when we let go and start drifting away. Something ordinary suddenly becomes the impulse for our imagination and we find ourselves wondering where reality ends and imagination starts. Only to wake up realising that it was only relativity playing with us.' Director: Jonas & Julien Production: Builders Club Producer/Editor: Jonas Hegi VFX: Builders Club Prod Coord.: Ester Viana Art Direction: Viviana Fagnani DOP: Tom Elliott AC: Marit de Bruijne Phantom OP: Joe Werry Styling: Coline Bach Hair & Makeup: Lucinda Worth
Technique - Levitation , Slow Motion
Director - Jonas & Julien
DOP - Tom Elliott

videos.alt_text: "The Fear Cycle" Film - Unveiling Sleep Paralysis Through Art
videos.title: "The Fear Cycle" Film - Unveiling Sleep Paralysis Through Art (2024)
videos.description: "The Fear Cycle" film explores Nicolas Bruno’s experiences with Sleep Paralysis, a sleep disorder that causes vivid nightmares. Bruno transforms his fears into artwork, giving viewers a glimpse into each dream sequence. This film delves into Bruno's creative journey, showcasing his artistic process, dream journal entries, and theatrical renditions of his visions.
videos.additional_info:
"The Fear Cycle" Film - Unveiling Sleep Paralysis Through Art (2024)

videos.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World (2010)
videos.description: In this offbeat romantic comedy, Michael Cera is Scott Pilgrim, the underachieving musician on a quest to win a record deal by facing off against seven evil exes to impress his girlfriend, Ramona Flowers (Mary Elizabeth Winstead). Because nothing says love like defeating exes in epic bass battles—just your typical, everyday relationship hurdles.

videos.title: Ken Carson - Fighting My Demons (2023)
videos.description: The music video for "Fighting My Demons" by Ken Carson, directed by Cole Bennett, was released in 2023 and features unique, glitchy visuals. The video presents a series of grainy, 3D footage that gives off the impression of being shot with night-vision goggles, offering a surreal viewing experience. It mainly showcases Ken Carson partying and performing his lyrics, creating a montage that aligns with the song's themes. The video's eerie and dark aesthetics were noted for drawing inspiration from the style of 1990s Japanese cinema, culminating in a profound, existential moment where Ken faces a haunting black void, adding depth and narrative to the visual experience.
videos.additional_info:
